about.name: Oslo
about.info_text: Oslo, the capital of Norway, is a vibrant and modern city nestled at the head of the Oslofjord. It's known for its harmonious blend of natural beauty, cutting-edge architecture, and rich cultural heritage. Oslo offers a high quality of life, with a strong focus on sustainability, making it a wonderful destination for exploring the great outdoors and experiencing Nordic culture. From world-class museums to pristine forests and fjords, Oslo has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 700,000
County: Oslo
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: Norwegian
Currency: Norwegian Krone (NOK)
about.climate_text: Oslo experiences a temperate maritime climate with warm summers and cold winters. Summer temperatures range from 15°C to 25°C (59°F to 77°F), while winter temperatures can drop below freezing with occasional snowfall.

attractions_card.title: Vigeland Park
attractions_card.description: Vigeland Park, also known as Frogner Park, is the world's largest sculpture park created by a single artist, Gustav Vigeland. It features over 200 bronze and granite sculptures set amidst beautifully landscaped gardens.

attractions_card.title: The Viking Ship Museum
attractions_card.description: The Viking Ship Museum houses well-preserved Viking ships, artifacts, and historical treasures, offering a fascinating glimpse into Norway's seafaring history.

attractions_card.title: The Royal Palace
attractions_card.description: The Royal Palace is the official residence of the Norwegian monarch in Oslo. Visitors can witness the changing of the guard and explore the palace grounds.

attractions_card.title: Holmenkollen Ski Jump
attractions_card.description: Holmenkollen Ski Jump is a historic ski jump that has hosted numerous ski jumping competitions. The accompanying museum showcases the history of skiing and winter sports.

attractions_card.title: Aker Brygge
attractions_card.description: Aker Brygge is a popular waterfront district with a mix of shops, restaurants, and entertainment. It offers stunning views of the Oslo Fjord and is a hub for leisure and dining.

attractions_card.title: The Fram Museum
attractions_card.description: The Fram Museum houses the polar exploration ship Fram, which carried famous explorers like Roald Amundsen on their expeditions to the North and South Poles.

attractions_card.title: Opera House
attractions_card.description: The Oslo Opera House is a striking architectural gem with a sloping roof that visitors can walk on. It's a cultural center for opera, ballet, and music performances.

attractions_card.title: Norsk Folkemuseum
attractions_card.description: Norsk Folkemuseum is an open-air museum that showcases traditional Norwegian buildings, cultural artifacts, and historical exhibitions.

food_card.title: Smørrebrød
food_card.description: Smørrebrød is an open-faced sandwich, a Danish and Norwegian specialty. It features various toppings like herring, roast beef, and egg salad on rye bread.

food_card.title: Gravlaks
food_card.description: Gravlaks is a Norwegian version of gravlax, a cured salmon dish served with mustard sauce, dill, and traditional Norwegian flatbread.

food_card.title: Koldtbord
food_card.description: Koldtbord is a traditional Norwegian buffet-style meal featuring a variety of cold dishes, including seafood, meats, salads, and more.

food_card.title: Brunost
food_card.description: Brunost, or brown cheese, is a sweet, caramelized cheese that's a staple of Norwegian cuisine, often served with bread.

food_card.title: Raspeballer
food_card.description: Raspeballer are traditional Norwegian potato dumplings, typically served with a savory meat sauce.

hotels_card.title: The Thief
hotels_card.description: The Thief is a stylish, waterfront hotel in Tjuvholmen with contemporary design, art installations, and breathtaking views.

hotels_card.title: Grand Hotel Oslo
hotels_card.description: The Grand Hotel is a historic and luxurious landmark in Oslo, known for its elegance, high-class service, and prime location.

hotels_card.title: Scandic Holmenkollen Park
hotels_card.description: Scandic Holmenkollen Park is a classic hotel situated near the Holmenkollen Ski Jump, offering stunning views of the city and fjord.

hotels_card.title: Thon Hotel Opera
hotels_card.description: Thon Hotel Opera is a modern and comfortable hotel located next to the Oslo Opera House, providing convenient access to the city's cultural attractions.

hotels_card.title: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel
hotels_card.description: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel is a contemporary hotel in the city center, offering comfortable accommodations and modern amenities.

transport_card.title: Oslo Trams
transport_card.description: Oslo has an efficient tram system that provides easy access to various parts of the city, including popular attractions and neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Oslo Metro
transport_card.description: The Oslo Metro is another convenient mode of transportation, connecting the city and its suburbs.

transport_card.title: Ferries
transport_card.description: Ferries and boats are essential for exploring the Oslo Fjord and its islands, offering scenic views and leisurely trips.

transport_card.title: Oslo Gardermoen Airport
transport_card.description: Oslo Gardermoen Airport (OSL) is the primary international gateway to Oslo and the largest airport in Norway, serving both domestic and international flights.
